_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-EXECUTIVE SUMMARY - Kirklan Agronomy

1  The Facility Policy

        The owners ,management, and employees of Midland-Impact, LLP are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur,the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department,LEPC, or other authorities, to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to people and the environment.

2. Facility Information

        The primary activity at Kirklan Agronomy is the storage and blending of fertilizers for custom application and sales to farmers.

Anhydrous ammonia is received , stored , and distributed for direct application for crop production nutrients.

The maximum quanity stored would be 360,000 pounds in our 18,000 gallon storage tank and 59 wagon type nurse tanks. The maximum quanity handled woud be the unloading of a semi transport holding 40,000 pounds.

3. The accident release prevention .

        Kirklin Agronomy has implemented the provisions of * Safety Requirements for the Storage 
and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia k-51* published by The American National Stanards Institute,Inc.,the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration(OSHA),29 CFR 1910.111* Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia* and the Office of Indiana State Chemists *Indiana Ammonia Law*.

4. The Five - year Accident History

There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five -years that:

-have caused any deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or enviromental damage.

5.The Emergency Response Program

This facilty has :

a. A written emergency response plan,in accordance with OSHA standard , 29 CFR 1910.36

b. Provided state and local authoritties the emergency planning and community right - to - know information
    as required under SARA Title lll(EPCRA).

c. A written emergency response program, in accordance with OSHA standard,29 CFR 1910.120, including

pre-emergency planning and employee training.

6. Planned  changes to improve safety.

      Safety improvement is an on-going process at this facility. Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance of safe conditions. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety
recommendation for implementation at this time.
